turn.0: ELI5: Why does/How can Walmart deny unions?
turn.1: Proof that they have "denied" unions?  Do all large employers have unions?  Their employees haven't gathered enough votes from a majority of employees to unionize--pretty simple.
turn.2: As a Walmart associate you are trained to, upon hearing talk about unionizing, tell your nearest superior.  The person who mentioned it will get fired every time, for just mentioning it.  They do not have to even mean it, employees all know Walmart will smite your ass for accidentally saying the word union around a manager.   It's common knowledge for even people who don't work at Walmart, Walmart employees have always been fired for just talking about what a union would accomplish or for simply saying the word union in conversation with another associate.

turn.6: So can they legally deny a majority vote of employees to unionize?
